alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 8:57AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Yolo, southeastern Colusa, Sutter, Sacramento, eastern Solano, western El Dorado, southwestern Placer, south central Butte, southwestern Sierra, Yuba, southwestern Nevada and west central Amador Counties through 1000 AM PST... At 853 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tisdale to near Vacaville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rain could bring local flooding, along with wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. TIME...Heavy rain will move through the greater Sacramento area between 930 am and 1000 am. Locations impacted include... Sacramento, Elk Grove, Roseville, Fairfield, Vacaville, Citrus Heights, Folsom, Davis, Rocklin, Woodland, Auburn, Grass Valley, Marysville, El Dorado Hills, Cameron Park, Carmichael, Fair Oaks, Yuba City, Rancho Cordova and West Sacramento. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
